meta.dc:rights: The Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation—
subsection.def: cancel (撤銷) means cancel under section 34 of the Ordinance;
cancellation date (撤銷日期), in relation to a registration, means the date on which the registration is cancelled;
discrepancy list (差異清單) means a document prepared under section 20(2);
ending date (結束日期), in relation to a short-term registration, means the date specified for the registration under section 6(1)(e);
endorsement application (批註申請) means an application under section 30(1);
first cut-off date (首個截數日期), in relation to an ordinary registration, means the date specified for the registration under section 6(1)(d);
ordinary registration (一般登記) means the ordinary registration mentioned in section 4(1)(a);
payable (須繳付) means payable under section 37(1) of the Ordinance;
recycling levy (循環再造徵費) means the levy prescribed under section 22(1);
registration (登記) means a registration under section 33 of the Ordinance;
registration date (登記日期), in relation to a registration, means the date specified for the registration under section 6(1)(b);
removal service (除舊服務) means a removal service under section 42(2) of the Ordinance;
reporting period (申報期) has the meaning given by section 12;
short-term registration (短期登記) means the short-term registration mentioned in section 4(1)(b);
specified form (指明表格) means a form specified under section 42.

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, an expression specified below has the same meaning as it has in section 31 of the Ordinance—

paragraph.content: consumer (消費者);
distribute (分發);
registered supplier (登記供應商);
removal service plan (除舊服務方案);
return (申報);
seller (銷售商);
supplier (供應商);

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application of Division 1
section.content: This Division applies to an application for registration under section 33 of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A supplier, or a person who proposes to be a supplier, may apply to the Director in the specified form for either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an ordinary registration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a short-term registration.

subsection.content: The applicant may, by giving the Director notice in writing, withdraw the application at any time before it is determined.

If, before the application is withdrawn or determined, a change in the information provided to the Director for the application occurs, the applicant must, as soon as reasonably practicable after the change occurs, give the Director notice of the change in writing.
The Director may, by giving the applicant notice in writing, require the applicant to provide further information and documents for the application.

subsection.leadIn: For both an ordinary registration and a short-term registration, the requirements for an application for the purposes of section 33(b) of the Ordinance are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application must be made in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant must comply with section 4(3), and any notice given under section 4(4);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant must be a supplier, or will become a supplier, according to the information provided for the application;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the information so provided must be correct and must not be misleading; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the applicant has already had an ordinary registration approved—the registration must have been cancelled.

subsection.leadIn: In addition to the requirements in subsection (1), for a short-term registration (intended short-term registration), the requirements for an application for the purposes of section 33(b) of the Ordinance are that the following criteria must be met—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: should the application be approved, the applicant’s business of distributing regulated electrical equipment under the intended short-term registration—

subparagraph.content: would be likely to operate for not more than 30 days; and
would be likely to give rise to the liability to pay a recycling levy not exceeding $20,000 under section 37(1) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the applicant has already had one or more than one recent short-term registration approved—should the application for the intended short-term registration be approved, the applicant’s business of distributing regulated electrical equipment under all of the latest short-term registrations would be likely to give rise to an aggregate liability to pay recycling levies not exceeding $20,000 under section 37(1) of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a short-term registration is a recent short-term registration if its ending date or cancellation date falls within 12 months before the date of the application for the intended short-term registration.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)(b)—
subsection.def: latest short-term registration (最近短期登記) means—(a)a recent short-term registration; or(b)the intended short-term registration.

subsection.leadIn: If an application is approved, the Director must issue a certificate of registration to the applicant and specify in the certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registration number assigned by the Director for the registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the registration becomes effective;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an annual audit date for the preparation of audit reports under section 39 of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for an ordinary registration—the first cut-off date for the preparation of returns; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for a short-term registration—the date on which the registration ceases to have effect.

subsection.content: The first cut-off date for an ordinary registration must fall on 31 March, 30 June, 30 September or 31 December.
The ending date for a short-term registration must fall within 30 days after the registration date.

subsection.leadIn: If an application is refused, the Director must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give the applicant notice in writing of the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include in the notice a statement setting out the reasons for the decision.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director intends to refuse the application, the Director must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give the applicant notice in writing of the intention and the reasons for the intention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the applicant an opportunity to make representations.

subsection.content: If the address of a registered supplier provided to the Director for an application made under section 4(1) has changed, the supplier must give the Director notice of the change in the specified form within 30 days after the date on which the change occurs.
A registered supplier who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Form of returns
section.content: A return must be submitted to the Director in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: A return submitted in respect of an ordinary registration must be submitted—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the first return—for the period beginning on the registration date and ending on the first cut-off date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a further return—for each quarter ending on 31 March, 30 June, 30 September or 31 December.

subsection.content: A return submitted in respect of a short-term registration must be submitted for the period beginning on the registration date and ending on the ending date.

subsection.leadIn: However—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the registration is cancelled during the period mentioned in subsection (1)(a), the reference to “first cut-off date” in that subsection is to be construed as a reference to “cancellation date”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the registration is cancelled during a quarter mentioned in subsection (1)(b), that quarter is deemed to end on the cancellation date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the registration is cancelled during the period mentioned in subsection (2), the reference to “ending date” in that subsection is to be construed as a reference to “cancellation date”.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Meaning of reporting period
section.def: reporting period (申報期)—(a)in relation to a return submitted in accordance with section 11(1)(a), means the period mentioned in that section, as modified by section 11(3)(a) if applicable;(b)in relation to a return submitted in accordance with section 11(1)(b), means the quarter mentioned in that section, as modified by section 11(3)(b) if applicable; or(c)in relation to a return submitted in accordance with section 11(2), means the period mentioned in that section, as modified by section 11(3)(c) if applicable.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Timing of returns
section.content: Subject to section 46(1), a return must be submitted within 28 days after the last day of each reporting period.

subsection.leadIn: A return must contain, in relation to each class of regulated electrical equipment— (27 of 2023 s. 25)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the number of such equipment that was distributed by the registered supplier in Hong Kong during the reporting period, with a breakdown of—

subparagraph.content: the number of such equipment that meets the description of section 37(1)(a)(i) of the Ordinance; and
the number of such equipment that meets the description of section 37(1)(a)(ii) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the number of such equipment that was used for the first time by the registered supplier in Hong Kong during the reporting period, with a breakdown of—

subparagraph.content: the number of such equipment that meets the description of section 37(1)(a)(i) of the Ordinance; and
the number of such equipment that meets the description of section 37(1)(a)(ii) of the Ordinance.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Records and Documents Relating to Returns

subsection.content: This section applies to the keeping of records and documents under section 38(4) of the Ordinance.

The registered supplier must keep records, invoices, receipts, delivery notes, inventory records or any other documents that contain sufficient details to enable the Director to readily verify the matters mentioned in subsection (3) in relation to a return.

subsection.leadIn: The matters are—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to each class of regulated electrical equipment—

subparagraph.content: the number of such equipment that was distributed by the registered supplier in Hong Kong during the reporting period;
the number of such equipment that was used for the first time by the registered supplier in Hong Kong during the reporting period;
the number of such equipment that was exported by the registered supplier out of Hong Kong during the reporting period; and

subparagraph.leadIn: among the equipment mentioned in each of subparagraphs (i), (ii) and (iii)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the number of such equipment that meets the description of section 37(1)(a)(i) of the Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the number of such equipment that meets the description of section 37(1)(a)(ii) of the Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the number of such equipment that does not meet the description of section 37(1)(a)(i), or section 37(1)(a)(ii), of the Ordinance.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Application of Subdivision 4
section.content: This Subdivision applies to the submission of audit reports under section 39(1) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Subdivision—
subsection.def: annual audit date (周年審計日), in relation to a registration, means the date specified for the registration under section 6(1)(c);
auditor (核數師), in relation to an audit report, means the person who prepares the report under section 39(2) of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: In this Subdivision, a reference to an audit year is, subject to subsection (3), a reference to the period of 12 months ending on an annual audit date.

subsection.leadIn: If the registration is cancelled during the period of 12 months ending on a particular annual audit date, a reference to an audit year is, in relation to that annual audit date, a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if that annual audit date is the first annual audit date for the registration—the period beginning on the registration date and ending on the cancellation date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that annual audit date is not the first annual audit date for the registration—the period beginning on the date immediately after the last preceding annual audit date, and ending on the cancellation date.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Coverage of audit reports
section.content: An audit report must cover a return if the reporting period of the return falls within the relevant audit year.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Timing of audit reports
section.content: Subject to section 46(1), an audit report must be submitted within 3 months after the last day of each audit year.

subsection.leadIn: The auditor must state in the audit report whether, in the opinion of the auditor and in relation to any return covered by the report, the following statements are true—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registered supplier had kept records and documents in accordance with section 38(4) of the Ordinance, and in accordance with section 15;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the return had been prepared in accordance with those records and documents; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the quantities of regulated electrical equipment reported in the return had been reported in accordance with the Ordinance.

subsection.content: If the auditor identifies any discrepancy between a return covered by the audit report and the records and documents kept for the return as mentioned in subsection (1)(a) in relation to any quantity of regulated electrical equipment, the auditor must set out the discrepancy in a document in the specified form.

If a discrepancy list has been prepared for an audit report in accordance with subsection (2), the registered supplier must, in submitting the report, attach a copy of the discrepancy list to the report.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Exemption from submission of audit reports

subsection.content: A registered supplier may apply to the Director in writing for exemption from submitting an audit report for a particular audit year.
Subject to section 46(1), the application must be made within 1 month after the last day of the relevant audit year.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must approve the application if—

subparagraph.content: the reporting periods falling within the relevant audit year cover less than 12 months in total; and
the Director is satisfied that the aggregate recycling levies payable for the reporting periods do not exceed $20,000; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a short-term registration—the Director is satisfied that the recycling levy payable for the reporting period does not exceed $20,000.

subsection.content: For the purposes of Division 3 of Part 4 of the Ordinance, an amount of recycling levy per item of regulated electrical equipment for each class of such equipment is set out in Schedule 1.
A term specified in column 2 of Schedule 1 has the same meaning as it has in Schedule 6 to the Ordinance.
This section applies to the payment of recycling levy under section 38(3) of the Ordinance.
The payment must be made within 30 days after the day on which the payment notice was served on the registered supplier under section 38(2)(b) of the Ordinance.
The payment must be made in accordance with the payment instructions contained in the payment notice.
This section applies to the payment under section 40(9) of the Ordinance of an amount of recycling levy demanded under an assessment notice.

subsection.leadIn: The payment must be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the assessment notice has not been replaced under section 40(5) of the Ordinance—within 30 days after the day on which the notice was served on the relevant person under section 40(4) of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the assessment notice has been replaced with another assessment notice under section 40(5) of the Ordinance—within 30 days after the day on which the other notice was served on the relevant person under that section.

subsection.content: The payment must be made in accordance with the payment instructions contained in the assessment notice.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—
subsection.def: relevant person (有關人士) means the relevant person mentioned in section 40 of the Ordinance.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Adjustment of payable amount with reference to discrepancy list

subsection.content: This section applies if a registered supplier has submitted an audit report under section 39(1) of the Ordinance with a discrepancy list attached in relation to a return (reported return) in accordance with section 20(3).

In determining the amount of recycling levy payable for the first subsequent return (if any), the Director may, with reference to the discrepancy list mentioned in subsection (1), adjust the amount so as to offset any amount of recycling levy that has been or will be overpaid or unpaid by the registered supplier for the reported return as a result of a discrepancy set out on the discrepancy list.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—
subsection.def: first subsequent return (其後首份申報) means the first return submitted by the registered supplier after the supplier has submitted the audit report as mentioned in subsection (1).

subsection.content: This section applies if a person has paid an amount of money to the Director for compliance with section 37(1) of the Ordinance.
The person may lodge a written claim with the Director for refund of any overpaid recycling levy paid by the person.
The claim must be accompanied by evidence of the claimant’s entitlement to the refund.

For the purposes of subsection (3), an audit report submitted under section 39(1) of the Ordinance with a discrepancy list attached in accordance with section 20(3) is evidence of a discrepancy set out on the discrepancy list unless the contrary is proved.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving the claim, the Director must refund any overpaid recycling levy to the claimant if the Director is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the claimant is entitled to the refund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the overpaid recycling levy is not recoverable by the claimant by the operation of section 25.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: overpaid recycling levy (超額徵費) means an amount of money that was paid by a person as mentioned in subsection (1) in excess of the amount that was payable by the person.

subsection.content: This section applies if a seller provides a receipt to a consumer for any regulated electrical equipment under section 35(2)(b) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The receipt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be provided in either paper or electronic form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must contain the wording, in both the English and the Chinese languages, set out in Schedule 2.

subsection.leadIn: The receipt must be provided not later than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the making of any payment for the regulated electrical equipment by the consumer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the taking of actual possession of the equipment by the consumer,

section.name: s29
section.heading: Application of Subdivision 1
section.content: This Subdivision applies to the endorsement of a plan as a removal service plan under section 41(1) of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: A seller, or a person who proposes to be a seller, may apply to the Director in the specified form for the endorsement.
The applicant may, by giving the Director notice in writing, withdraw the application at any time before it is determined.

If, before the application is withdrawn or determined, a change in the information provided to the Director for the application occurs, the applicant must, as soon as reasonably practicable after the change occurs, give the Director notice of the change in writing.
The Director may, by giving the applicant notice in writing, require the applicant to provide further information and documents for the application.

subsection.leadIn: The following requirements are the requirements under section 41(3)(c) of the Ordinance—

subparagraph.content: must not specify more than 5 collectors; (L.N. 142 of 2017)
must specify 1 collector who meets the requirement specified in subsection (2) as a default collector; and

must indicate in the specified form whether the seller will provide a removal service in case none of the collectors specified in the plan is able and willing to provide the service; and (L.N. 142 of 2017)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the undertaking under section 41(3)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance must be made in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: The requirement mentioned in subsection (1)(a)(ii) is that, as part of the plan, the collector undertakes to the seller in the specified form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide removal services in respect of every particular class of regulated electrical equipment distributed by the applicant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to provide the services on any premises in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: Subsections (1)(b) and (2) do not prevent parties to the undertakings from incorporating any mutually agreed terms and conditions into the undertakings.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)(a)(ii)—
subsection.def: default collector (預定收集者) means the first collector whom the seller is to approach for arranging for a removal service on a consumer’s request.

subsection.content: The other grounds on which the Director may refuse to endorse a plan as mentioned in section 41(2) of the Ordinance are specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The Director may refuse to endorse a plan if the Director is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the endorsement application has not been made in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has not complied with section 30(3), or any notice given under section 30(4);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant is not a seller, or will not become a seller, according to the information provided for the application;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the information so provided is incorrect or misleading;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the plan is impracticable; (L.N. 142 of 2017)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the applicant has already had a plan endorsed; or (L.N. 142 of 2017)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the applicant will not be able to cause the electrical equipment or electronic equipment removed by the applicant in accordance with the plan to be properly treated, reprocessed or recycled. (L.N. 142 of 2017)

section.name: s33
section.heading: Application approved
section.leadIn: If an endorsement application is approved, the Director must give the applicant notice in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of endorsement.

subsection.leadIn: If an endorsement application is refused, the Director must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give the applicant notice in writing of the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include in the notice a statement setting out the reasons for the decision.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director intends to refuse the application, the Director must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give the applicant notice in writing of the intention and the reasons for the intention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the applicant an opportunity to make representations.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Application for change to removal service plan

subsection.content: No change may be made to a removal service plan of a seller unless the seller applies to the Director in the specified form for approval to do so.
Subject to section 38, the application must be made at least 30 days before the day on which the change is proposed to take effect.
On receiving the application, the Director must give the applicant notice in writing of the date of receipt of application.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant may, by giving the Director notice in writing, withdraw the application at any time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the expiry of 30 days after the date of receipt of application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: before a notice is given under section 37(4),

subsection.content: The Director may, by giving the applicant notice in writing, require the applicant to provide further information and documents for the application.
Section 71(1)(b) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1) does not apply to the period of 30 days under subsection (4)(a).

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: seller (銷售商) includes a person who proposes to be a seller.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Changing information regarded as making fresh application

subsection.content: If, before an application made under section 35(1) (original application) is withdrawn or determined, a change in the information provided to the Director for the original application occurs, the applicant must, as soon as reasonably practicable after the change occurs, give the Director notice of the change in writing.

subsection.leadIn: If a notice is given under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant is taken to make a fresh application under section 35(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the original application is taken to be withdrawn.

subsection.content: An application under section 35(1) is taken to be approved by the Director on the expiry of 30 days after the date of receipt of application unless the application has been approved or refused before the expiry.

The Director must refuse the application if the Director is satisfied that the removal service plan would no longer meet a certain requirement specified in section 41(3) of the Ordinance should the proposed change be incorporated into the plan.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may also refuse the application if the Director is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application has not been made in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has not complied with section 35(2) or 36(1), or any notice given under section 35(5);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant is not a seller, or will not become a seller, according to the information provided for the application;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the information so provided is incorrect or misleading; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the removal service plan would become impracticable should the proposed change be incorporated into the plan.

subsection.leadIn: If the application is refused, the Director must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give the applicant notice in writing of the decision within 30 days after the date of receipt of application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include in the notice a statement setting out the reasons for the decision.

subsection.content: Section 71(1)(b) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1) does not apply to the period of 30 days under subsection (4)(a).
This section applies if a seller makes a change application.
The seller may apply to the Director for exemption from section 35(2).
An exemption application must be made in the specified form in conjunction with the change application.
The Director may approve the exemption application if the Director is satisfied that it is reasonable to do so in the circumstances of the case.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: change application (更改申請) means an application under section 35(1);
exemption application (豁免申請) means an application under subsection (2);
seller (銷售商) includes a person who proposes to be a seller.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: distributed equipment (獲分發電器), in relation to a request for a removal service made by a consumer as mentioned in paragraph (b) of section 42(2) of the Ordinance, means the item of regulated electrical equipment distributed to the consumer as mentioned in paragraph (a) of that section; (L.N. 142 of 2017)
distribution transaction (分發交易) means a transaction in which distributed equipment is distributed by a seller. (L.N. 142 of 2017)

section.name: s40
section.heading: Requests for removal services
section.leadIn: A request for a removal service must be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the manner specified by the seller; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 3 days after the consumer enters into the distribution transaction with the seller.

subsection.content: The seller must, for the prescribed period, keep a record of each request for a removal service.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the record must contain the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information that enables the identification of the distribution transaction (for example, a transaction number); (L.N. 142 of 2017)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the times at which the request was made and received;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the manners in which the request was made and received;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: proof that the actual remover had been informed of the address of the premises from which the pre-existing equipment was to be removed; (L.N. 142 of 2017)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the date of collection of the pre-existing equipment as agreed by the actual remover; (L.N. 142 of 2017)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: if the actual remover was a collector other than the default collector—the default collector’s written confirmation that the default collector was unable or unwilling to provide the requested service, and the reasons; (L.N. 142 of 2017)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: if the actual remover was the seller—a written confirmation by each collector specified in the removal service plan that the collector was unable or unwilling to provide the requested service, and the reasons. (L.N. 142 of 2017)

subsection.content: If any information mentioned in subsection (2) is unavailable, that subsection is taken to be complied with if the record contains an indication of that fact.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: actual remover (實際除舊者) means—(a)the collector who actually provides a removal service; or(b)if a seller provides the service—the seller; (L.N. 142 of 2017)
default collector (預定收集者) has the meaning given by section 31(4);
pre-existing equipment (現有電器), in relation to a request for a removal service, means the item of electrical equipment or electronic equipment to be removed on that request;

prescribed period (訂明期間) means the period—(a)beginning at the time when the distribution transaction is made; and(b)ending on the expiry of 1 year after the day on which the distribution transaction is made. (L.N. 142 of 2017)

section.name: s42
section.heading: Director may specify forms
section.content: The Director may specify any forms required for the purposes of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Regulation, a specified form may require that— (27 of 2023 s. 29)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it be completed in a specified way;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specified information or documents be included in or attached to it; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it be submitted in a specified manner.

subsection.content: If a certain requirement under subsection (1) is not complied with for making an application under this Regulation, the application is to be treated as not made in the specified form. (27 of 2023 s. 29)
If a certain requirement under subsection (1) is not complied with for submitting a return under this Regulation, the return is to be treated as not submitted in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must make copies of a specified form available—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during office hours at the office of the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: through any other means that the Director considers appropriate.

subsection.content: If the Director specifies an electronic record as a specified form, the requirement for a signature in the form is satisfied by a password assigned or approved under subsection (2).

The Director may, for enabling a person to use an electronic record as a specified form, from time to time assign or approve any sequence or combination of letters, characters, numbers or symbols as the person’s password.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Right of appeal to Appeal Board

subsection.leadIn: The following decisions are appealable matters for the purposes of section 13(2) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refusal of an application made under section 33 of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b

subsection.content: If an appeal is made under section 13 of the Ordinance against a decision specified in subsection (1), the appeal does not affect the operation of the decision pending the determination of the appeal unless the Director decides otherwise.
If the last day on which a specified act may be done falls on an excluded day, the act is considered as done if it is done on the next following day, not being an excluded day.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: excluded day (豁除日) means—(a)a Saturday;(b)a general holiday; or(c)a gale warning day, or black rainstorm warning day, as defined by section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1);

specified act (指明作為) means—(a)the submission of a return in accordance with section 13;(b)the submission of an audit report in accordance with section 19; or(c)the making of an application in accordance with section 21(2).
